intro: Hovea heterophylla f. decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive hovea, is a unique variant of the hovea plant characterized by its morphological adaptations. This plant belongs to the Fabaceae family and is native to Australia, where it thrives in specific ecological niches. Its foliage exhibits heterophylly, meaning it displays different leaf forms depending on environmental conditions. The plant's flowers are typically small and clustered, producing pods that contain seeds adapted for dispersal. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptation and evolution.
